metadata.title: CVE-2020-6831 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: A buffer overflow could occur when parsing and validating SCTP chunks in WebRTC. This could have led to memory corruption and a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 68.8, Firefox < 76, and Thunderbird < 68.8.0.

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '76.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:68.8.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
